elements.content: Unusual solvent-mediated hydrolysis of dicarboxylate monoester ligands in copper(II) complexes toward simultaneous crystallization of new dicarboxylate derivatives†IIJayanta K. NathAlexander M. Kirillov and Jubaraj B. BaruahIIIIII1234567II8II910111c12131415Hydrolysis of a dicarboxylate monoester copper(II) complex.II16IISome representative modes of dicarboxylate binding by copper(II) ions.IIIIIIIITransformation of complex 1 to coordination polymer 2.(a) Image of a crystal of complex 1. (b–d) Images of a partially transformed crystal of complex 1 wetted by methanol under ambient conditions after (b) 1 h, (c) 2 h and (d) 3 h.IIProposed mechanism for the hydrolysis of 1.8,9IIIIII17a–d17a,eStructural fragments of complex 1. (a) Ellipsoid plot (30% probability). (b) H-bonding pattern showing the interlinkage of monocopper(II) units into a 2D H-bonded layer; H atoms apart from those of H-bonds are omitted for clarity; color codes: Cu green balls, O red, N blue, C gray, H dark gray. (c) Topological representation of the simplified uninodal 4-connected 2D net with the sql topology and the point symbol of (44·62); green balls are the centroids of 4-connected [Cu(cmb)2(im)2] nodes.

metadata.title: Unusual solvent-mediated hydrolysis of dicarboxylate monoester ligands in copper( ii ) complexes toward simultaneous crystallization of new dicarboxylate derivatives
